item.title: Ronald Drimmel
item.description:
#DarkSky International (formally #IDA) has announced the winners of it's 2023 Capture the Dark photography contest. For some beautiful dark sky photography, check out the finalists:
https://darksky.org/news/2023-capture-the-dark-winners/

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Coding an experiment from scratch can be a great way to learn python üêç If you'de like to get started we will be running a workshop on this next week! https://workshops.psychopy.org/topics/coding-an-experiment.html#topicscode

item.title: Jonathan Peelle
item.description: For no reason in particular I made this highly accurate Venn diagram during a college meeting todayhttps://xkcd.com/773/

item.title: Fediverse Report
item.description: The Swiss Government has officially launched their Mastodon server at https://social.admin.ch/In their official press release the Government confirms it is a trial for one year. They state that "Mastodon has several characteristics that make it fundamentally attractive for government communications", such as being beyond the control of others, as well as it being privacy friendly.Official press release: https://www.admin.ch/gov/de/start/dokumentation/medienmitteilungen.msg-id-97696.htmlSpeaker of the Swiss Government: @gov

item.title: Cian O‚ÄôDonnell
item.description: In neurophysiology people often estimate "phase coherence", ie the trial-to-trial alignment of some brain signal (EEG/MEG/LFP) to some oscillation.This is hard using frequentist stats, so Sydney Dimmock, me & @conorjh developed a better Bayesian method.Now in press in eLife: https://elifesciences.org/articles/84602

item.title: Robin Gutzen
item.description:
Tomorrow, I'll be giving a short introductory talk on why and how we model neurons in #neuroscience in a simplified way to the general audience of a #NeuroArt workshop. üë®‚Äçüé®üß†
Where would you say are some limits of point neuron models in terms of what functions they may implement?

item.title: Rapha√´l L√©vy
item.description:
Very interesting video (in French) of St√©phanie Ruphy, director of the French office for scientific integrity. Seems to me that she is highlighting several of the key issues where the system needs to change - of course, given her position this is done diplomatically - but good to see that these are high on the OFIS roadmap (incl correction of science, transparency, appropriate sanctions)
https://mastodon.top/@raphavisses/111052403755002415

item.title: Kristian
item.description: v:dw is by far the most useful acronym I've run across recently, much more relevant than tl;dr.video: didn't watch.

item.title: Konrad Kording
item.description: More oxygen makes you learn faster. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0166432823003765

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Predatory publishers email everyone who posts preprints. I would think that Gmail would be better at filtering those out by now, but I still get multiple per week and have to make new filters for them manually. There are so many predatory publishers because the model works-- they make money-- unfortunately.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
